DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Resolution Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question that asks whether the Adverse Event has or have resolved.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to adverse event settled or resolved.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth; also, the size of the smallest element that can be separated from neighboring elements. The term is used in optics, to describe imaging systems, in genetics and molecular biology, to define the degree of molecular detail on a physical map of DNA, ranging from low to high.

Concepts.definition: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: OHSU Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did AE resolve prior to initiation of next cycle?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the AE resolved to grade 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the AE resolved to less than or equal to grade 2

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the AE resolved to less than or equal to grade 1

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the AE resolved within 6 hours

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the AE resolved to grade 2 or less?
